Having a couple of meat-free meals a week
is a really easy way to slash your bills.

And believe you and me, you won't be missing
out with something as stunning as this. A delicious

Ok so this recipe is all about bigging up

the veg. The story begins with one large aubergine.
So what I wanna do is just roast this off.

Cut a aubergine up into nice little chunks.
Now to start loading up the flavours with

two red onions. Just peel them and roughly
slice them. Throw them into a oven proof dish

along with the aubergine. Next up dollop in
four heaped teaspoons of Rogan Josh curry

paste. Along with four cloves of garlic, a
little oil, sea salt and two thumb sized pieces

of ginger. Have nice little massage up. Get it
in one nice fine layer, just like that. So

whack this in the oven at 180 degrees. After
about 20 minutes, they'll be cooked down and

super sticky. So now for the delicious daal,
I'm using 500g of yellow spilt peas. Stir

in a veggie stock cube and two litres of boiling
water. Go in with half of the roast veggies

to boost the flavour. And it's gonna go really
thick, kinda with a mash potato texture.

Shimmer for about an hour and 20 minutes until the
spilt peas are tender and gorgeous.

I'm gonna pop this aubergine back in the oven and turn
it off. Just to keep it warm.
Next up is the homemade chapattis. 250g of wholemeal flour, salt, olive oil, 150ml of water

and boom, the perfect chapati dough. It's good to give
it a ruddy good needing, just for 30 seconds or a minute

Then roll into a nice sausage
shape and divide into 12 portions.

So just flatten it out, like that, into your flour
and roll it out. Couple of rolls, turn it,

couple of rolls turn it. Cook on a medium
heat for just over a minute on each side.

Let's just turn these over, it's all looking pretty
damn good. And keep warm until you're ready

to eat. And one last thing you gonna do that's
gonna give you a hit, it's called a Tempeh.

And a tempeh is basically a herbed or spiced
oil. Start by frying a few mustard seeds in

some groundnut oil. Finely slice one chilli
and then we're gonna add to the story an amazing

herb. Curry leaves are like the phenomenon that
transform your curries.
Now no curry would be completely without a side of rice. I'm using basmati. Time to plate up this feast of thrift.
The daal is thickened to perfection.

Get your beautiful chapatis ready and raring to go. And unleash those roasted curry veggies
that were warming in the oven.
Finally, scatter over the fragrant tempeh.
And what you'll do, is you'll get little pools of those beautiful spices and oil around that daal.

So simple,
so wholesome. It's a delicious dinner.
